title.value: Responsible AI Research Needs Impact Statements Too
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned at the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Responsible AI Research Needs Impact Statements Too

extractions.description: The paper argues for the necessity of including adverse impact statements in Responsible AI (RAI) research. It highlights the shortcomings in current RAI research regarding the reflection on possible negative outcomes and offers suggestions for more meaningful engagement with the impact of such research.

type.justification: The paper primarily discusses the conceptual and theoretical need for including adverse impact statements in RAI research, providing arguments and suggestions rather than empirical data.
type.quote: This trend of failing to reflect on the possible negative impact of our own work should concern all of us, as the research we conduct and the artifacts we build are more often than not value-laden...

name.justification: The paper primarily discusses ethical considerations and the need for impact statements in Responsible AI research, which falls under the broader category of Ethics in AI.
name.quote: All types of research, development, and policy work can have unintended, adverse consequencesâ€”work in responsible artificial intelligence (RAI), ethical AI, or ethics in AI is no exception.

name.justification: The paper explicitly focuses on Responsible AI and its need to include adverse impact statements.
name.quote: We believe responsible AI research needs impact statements, too.

name.justification: The paper discusses Ethical AI as part of the broader scope of work that needs to reflect on its own potential adverse impacts.
name.quote: work in responsible artificial intelligence (RAI), ethical AI, or ethics in AI is no exception.
